messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] We're not alone
messages.msgSnippet: My Mom and I always crack each other up because of this -- we ll have some situation or problem to deal with, and we ll research or make phone calls or
messages.messageBody:
My Mom and I always crack each other up because of this -- we'll have some
situation or problem to deal with, and we'll research or make phone calls or
whatever -- and, whadda ya know, we weren't the first ones to deal with figuring
out a reverse mortgage or car insurance or a medical question! It always feels
like we're the only ones dealing with something until we reach that "aha!"
moment when we realize we aren't -- then we laugh at ourselves -- "Again? You'd
think we'd learn faster than this!"

Anyway -- you're not alone in figuring any of this out! :)

Nance


In a message dated 6/22/2004 4:24:52 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
We are all currently "deschooling" - me included, to try to rid ourselves of
the concepts and beliefs that we were inundated with in the public school
system. I've found these email lists to be supportive and helpful,
especially
when I'm feeling like the only one who is struggling or wondering about
something.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
